publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3557 Ms Wendy Alexander: Congratulations to St Mirren Football Club—That the Parliament recognises the tremendous achievement of St Mirren Football Club in winning the Scottish Challenge Cup and pays tribute to Gus MacPherson and his team for bringing the cup home to Paisley; further recognises the ambitious plans of St Mirren Football Club as it makes progress towards a new stadium; wishes the team well in the First Division for the remainder of the year, and hopes that its continuing success will allow the team and stadium to grace in due course the highest heights of the Scottish Premier League.

S2M-3557 Ms Wendy Alexander: Congratulations to St Mirren Football Club—That the Parliament recognises the tremendous achievement of St Mirren Football Club in winning the Scottish Challenge Cup and pays tribute to Gus MacPherson and his team for bringing the cup home to Paisley; further recognises the ambitious plans of St Mirren Football Club as it makes progress towards a new stadium; wishes the team well in the First Division for the remainder of the year, and hopes that its continuing success will allow the team and stadium to grace in due course the highest heights of the Scottish Premier League. Supported by: Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Colin Fox*, Mr Bruce McFee*, Brian Adam*, Murray Tosh*, Mr Alasdair Morrison*, Tommy Sheridan*, Bruce Crawford*, Helen Eadie*, Jackie Baillie*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Bill Butler*
S2M-3557 Congratulations to St Mirren Football Club (lodged on 10 November 2005) Trish Godman*, Dennis Canavan*
S2M-3557 Congratulations to St Mirren Football Club (lodged on 10 November 2005) John Swinburne*, Michael Matheson*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-3557 Congratulations to St Mirren Football Club (lodged on 10 November 2005) Scott Barrie*
S2M-3557 Congratulations to St Mirren Football Club (lodged on 10 November 2005) Mr Brian Monteith*
